intro: Scleria clathrata, commonly known as the netleaf sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular, grass-like stems and its distinctive, net-veined leaves. Scleria clathrata typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, which are followed by three-angled, capsule-like fruits.
